website_summaries.verdict: Choose this granite mortar and pestle if you want a stone set that offers classic looks for a decent price. Mortar easily doubles as a serving bowl, but be careful not to scratch your table.
pros: Offers a reasonable price for a solid granite set in a versatile size
Design makes it easy to thoroughly grind ingredients
Doesn't require extensive prep before use
cons: Feels weighty, but this is a testament to its durability
Leg bottoms are rough and can scratch surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with using rice to remove silt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a mortar and pestle. Forget about using rice to smooth it out and remove the stone's powder, buy a cheap knife sharpening stone like this (see below), rub it gently on the fine side for about ten minutes and wash with soap and water. There, I saved you carpal tunnel syndrome and 3+ hours of your life.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Using it as display, but send nicely made especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a prop, so I can't say much about is intended purpose. Size overall is impressive, although depth seems adequate for small to moderate portions (2inches deep at the middle). If you want to make guac for a party, not sure about it. I'm impressed with the sheer size and weight of it though, and for some reason I did not expect for it to be solid one piece granite, very pleased. Has a light powdery residue on it's surfaces, but I'm sure that will rinse off. For the price, a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: chrisT

customer_reviews.title: Good product work after little cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product made from granite stone and not concrete. Needed to little cleanup with water and rice. Now well and perfect. It's expected from natural transitional methods.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: can't
customer_reviews.text: Can't get this thing to stop feeling dusty to the touch. It is not suitable for making pesto. It ruins my basil, with a gritty dust, even though I've taken water and rice several times to it, to 'season,' after all of this it is still dusty to the touch. I don't trust it for my food.
customer_reviews.author: Diane and Tav

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality mortar and pestle
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality mortar and pestle. I haven't had the issues as I've seen in other reviews with food getting caught in the grooves of the mortar, as mine arrived very smooth. I did use the pestle on it dry first, then washed it, to make sure I wasn't eating little bits of dust and stone, but I have no complaints. But please note this thing is HUGE, even bigger than I was expecting. I believe the interior diameter is 8 inches (rather than the exterior diameter) which makes this great to use as a serving bowl for guacamole and other dips, but a little big if you're just using it to grind dry spices and rubs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Boese

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable to work with
customer_reviews.text: I find a molcajete easier to work with than a smaller mortar and pestle. The size of the bowl and the shape of the tajolote (pestle) feel more comfortable in my hand. Another interesting thing is that the energy of happy pounding and grinding gets translated into the food, which is probably why salsas tastes so much better from one of these. The only down side is that it is not the greatest for medications, too much gets caught in the grooves. So I've kept my smooth little mortar, but tossed the pestle, and will use the tajolote instead.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: I like this product better than a food processor
customer_reviews.text: really like the molcajete, it is attractive enough to leave out on the counter and it is easy to grind roasted garlic, onion, avocado, etc. I have been making awesome guacamole since I got this product. Just make sure you season it before using it - grind rice and cold water to remove any loose stone, then rub with olive oil, don't apply soap to clean, just water & always wipe clean with olive oil.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Maestas

customer_reviews.title: good, but not great.  but you have to keep it in perspective.
customer_reviews.text: the bowl interior is relatively coarse. this is great when breaking down things like vegetables, peppers, and small fruits for pastes, jams, guacamole, etc. however, if you're trying to make powder it'll be pretty tough to achieve flour consistency. also, this is just about as crudely made as you can imagine. i bout this for function over form, so i don't care about that. if this is a centerpiece of your meal as you prepare something at a dinner party or outdoor function it may get some slight criticism. otherwise, it's works great and isn't expensive. DARNED hard to clean without a brush, FYI.
customer_reviews.author: michael w

customer_reviews.title: Please ensure you understand this item is unpolished and turns to fine sand when used.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what this can actually be used for. The granite flakes off as sand into whatever you're grinding up -- it completely ruined my bacon, my bread crumbles, my avocado mash. Its quite literally not edible -- I do not think this item is food safe. Its very sturdy, well made, large, and beautiful. But again, other than looking good, I'm not sure what this can be used for. Immediate return.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a marble mortar and pestle for about 30 years now, and for some strange reason I decided to cough up the $17 bucks for this molcajete. I'm ecstatic. It is so, so much better than marble. I love how the tejolote fits in my hand (palm). It's so much better than a standard pestle, and the texture of the molcajete grinds hard spices in no time. Can't wait to get going on some guac. Well worth the price. There's something to be said about thousand-year-old technology. If you know anyone who wants a free marble mortar and pestle, call me.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Dickbags

customer_reviews.title: it is pretty well broken in
customer_reviews.text: I never had one of these before, It left granite residue inside. Then I figured out that it had to be "broken in". I ground up hole corn from my deer's food and made "corn meal" then I ground up eggshells, and anything that was hard. Now, it is pretty well broken in. I don't get any granite residue anymore. After all, this is a real good grinder. It's very much worth it.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: You all will love this BUT you have to be able to season aka prep it for maximum results. First they recommend putting rice in there and grinding it. I used brown rice and ground it until it was almost powder about 3/4 cup of brown rice. Then I emptied the rice and put water and ground it until the stone formed a sludge from both the mortar and pestle and they were shiny smooth. Then I put the almost powdered rice and mixed with water and continued until there was no hit of roughness. It took me 3 hours, it took me that long because I was watching What's New Scooby Doo on Netflix 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Tisha

customer_reviews.title: I found a good video about how to smooth out the surface
customer_reviews.text: This Molcajete comes with a rough surface, but that is to be expected. These things take some work to prepare them. I found a good video about how to smooth out the surface. It took quite a bit of elbow grease, but now it is really smooth and works great. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: VizRTPhil

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to my kitchen yet!
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite kitchen gadget! The 8 inch weighs like 15 pounds - so you are not going to hurt it. It will not tip over and is deep enough to handle most anything you would use it for. It can go from kitchen to table easily. Because it's granite, it's relatively easy to clean, but I only use it to grind herbs and spices.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy
customer_reviews.text: This item is very nice. It makes food taste better than a regular bowl. The 2 problems is its very heavy, which I understand but if you’re older or have hand problems it might not be good for you. Second is you need to cure it. This takes time, take a lot of energy and time. My hand and wrist was hurting for a a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ashro

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is really big and super heavy. It's very nice. So if that's what you want, it's great. I wanted my daughter to be able to grind up egg shells for her lizard. But it's way to bulky for that. It is really nice though
customer_reviews.author: Launi

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Little Molcajete
customer_reviews.text: I love how heavy it is in spite of its small size. I love the genuine grainy texture of it for crushing the harder seeds like allspice and cinnamon sticks. Even comes with a little guac recipe card. I like this set a lot because it gets the job done. Search online how to deep clean it but I use dish brushes, soap and water and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: The Royal One

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and is heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: It's a heavy duty molcajete. Well technically not really a Mexican molcajete but it works on the same order. It's attractive and the size is great. I'm not fond of the pestle. It bulky and too smooth for what I wanted it for. It needs "teeth" to actually bite into the garlic cloves or spices and the pestle is just too smooth. But I'll use my traditional molcajete for those jobs and use this one for making cracker crumbs or to break up nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Sandorae

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I received the grinder, super excited to use, however when I opened it there was dust inside the grinder I thought it may need just a little wash and it will be okay, however when I tried to grind nuts I end up with stone dust and I couldn't use the grounded nuts because it had all the stone dust. I would return this item.
customer_reviews.author: yzhabel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great size and good quality. Arrived fast and no damage. This grinder, like all granite mortar and pestles, needs a lot of work before use. It has to be "seasoned," which mostly consists of grinding the interior (with water) until both the mortar and pestle are smooth. If this is not done then tiny pieces of stone can be found in your food (or medicine). I was able to finish this task in about an hour...and yes my arms and hands were tired. After, I added a bit of white rice to finish the seasoning process, now it is perfect. Do not wash with soap, just water and a scrub brush if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Wells

customer_reviews.title: Big, heavy, rough surface.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I imagined, and gives off a powdery substance at first, even after washed. I found out that I have to "season" the bowl. The bowl is NOT polished, so will hold flavors a bit.
customer_reviews.author: D.C

customer_reviews.title: Got this beautiful piece as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this beautiful piece as a gift. My husband and I thoroughly enjoy making guacamole and salsas and were pleasantly surprised to see this would be the perfect serving bowl! When purchased the buyer wasn't expecting the size to be this large; however, we absolutely LOVE it and prefer it this way. It's an amazing quality granite and heavy/sturdy. Very very pleased. Way to go Amazon! Click the add to bag button... you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: BEST DEAL ON AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best deal on Amazon. Can’t believe how inexpensive this was. Perfect gift for my Mexican dad who insists making salsa in these makes it taste better. The quality is great. It’s HEAVY, sturdy, and is a decent size. It’s wide but not very deep but that’s ok. I can’t comment much on the easy ness to clean as it is not mine to clean.
customer_reviews.author: msgins

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to other but less expensive....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as part of a present for a friend's wedding. It is identical to ones sold for twice the price. When it arrived, my husband actually asked if we could buy them a different gift and keep this one.
customer_reviews.author: Corry Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, cure the thing and it's great. Just don't expect that you can pull this out of the box and get straight to making food stuffs.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great at grinding
customer_reviews.text: This looks nice on the counter. It does a quick job or grinding. My only complaint is that getting the ground spices out can be difficult bc it gets caught in the grinding ridges. I use a pastry brush to sweep out, which works well.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Good size for small to medium grinding jobs. The piece is well made, cleans up easily. Recommend a light washing before use to rid of any stone particles and dust. Then treat with a light coating of oil. Mine will get well used and it looks neat sitting on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: DewieG

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a good sized molcajete to make mole
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. I was looking for a good sized molcajete to make mole. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to make authentic Mexican cuisine! Don't forget to "season" the molcajete before you use it. Grind some white rice after you clean and dry it to smooth out the hondo y tejocote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like it may be too big
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would use it as much as I do. It seemed like it may be too big, but it's really a good size especially for the price. It was easy to clean, season, and use. I'm no expert, and if you're reading reviews on molcajetes you're probably not either, but I can say this is a good quality item at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Avocados slide around...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any experience using any tohers, so maybe this is a problem with all makes of these, but the avocado wasn't really "ground" but smeared around. It would just slide around a bunch in the bowl. Eventually it did mash up, but what should have taken 10 seconds took 60. (Seeds, on the other hand, had enough friction to not slide around, and ground up real well and fast.)
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: It's made out of Cement.
customer_reviews.text: Stay away. It's made out of Cement. Not to eat out of you will get sick.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grinding spices!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for grinding spices, Himalayan salt, pepper any type of seeds Works awesome. Have a larger one I purchased for making salsas and guacamole, perfect complement for my larger moljacate. But you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: S Adlerz

customer_reviews.title: Great for guacamole!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for guacamole! Very heavy, reasonably priced, good friction and perfect size for 1-2 cups of whatever you are smashing. Need to take care to not scratch whatever it is set upon when you use it.
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: This mortar and pestle ended up being a gift. ...
customer_reviews.text: This mortar and pestle ended up being a gift. It was quite large in size but that was a selling point as the recipient wanted it to make guac. It was really granite and was very heavy. Overall, I was impressed by the quality for the price. I'm thinking of ordering a second for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Alkinburgh

customer_reviews.title: Works great for guacamole
customer_reviews.text: Heavy! Works great for guacamole. Especially like the rough surface for getting a good grind on the avocado and fixings. Not very deep so we find ourselves doing a couple of batches and mixing in a separate bowl for larger parties.
customer_reviews.author: ChambersOhana

customer_reviews.title: IMUSA USA Granite Molcajete Spice GrinderFantastic Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Buy! Wonderful Molcajete. Perfect size and very heavy to stay where it should while you grind and mash. Love the feel of the pestle too. Bravo IMUSA USA!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: GREAT !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER USEFUL AND PERFECT SIZE FOR SMALL- MEDIUM QUANTITY. GRIND RICE AND WATER WHEN U FIRST GET IT TO HELP SETTLE IN THE ROCK AND STOP THE DEBRIS FROM FALLING OFF.
customer_reviews.author: CHULAA

customer_reviews.title: A very nice mortar and pestle..
customer_reviews.text: Boy, am I glad I ordered this smaller one! It was much larger than expected and perfect for grinding up herbs,pills,anything you might want to crush. It is very heavy and nicely shaped.
customer_reviews.author: Coastie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Bowl is heavy and large. Does a great job in preparing your guacamole. Rough surfaces as you would expect from unpolished stone. Great quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: FLebel

customer_reviews.title: Real Value!
customer_reviews.text: After all the smooth-walled, tiny mortar-and-pestle sets on our American market my hopes weren't too high with this. I shouldn't have doubted! This gorgeous thing is a grinding MACHINE. It is massive, incredibly rough, and extremely cool-looking.
customer_reviews.author: HarvestSong

customer_reviews.title: Great item, heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great item, heavy, looks great! -- Amazon will need to improve the packaging for an item this heavy. The first one arrived damaged and had to replace, the 2nd one arrived fine. But, I wont use the packaging, will use the product, and its just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Such a good quality item! It has helped so much with grinding spices and has made cooking and preparing so much fun! I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Theo T. Nicolaides

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice, big
customer_reviews.text: I just wish it was as described, specifically that it doesn't absorb oils and that the inner bowl was smooth. I'm sorry to say I found neither to be true. I'm not sure if it just wasn't processed completely or what. It is a nice, big, heavy bowl, but I am thinking I'll have to buy another different product to use as a pestle and mortar.
customer_reviews.author: Angel in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Back to basics, finally.
customer_reviews.text: In this world of technology sometimes it feels good to get back to basics. Grind food between 2 stones. Well like a certain president would say: make no mistake, this ain't as easy at it sounds. But this highly technical device is certainly good at it, provided you are.
customer_reviews.author: Buddie

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife, happy life.
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is big enough to make a good helping of guacamole. We all love the fact that we can make it fast and fresh. This Pestle and Mortar is quite heavy and should last a long time. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead8596

customer_reviews.title: Fresh spices...just like mom
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to make fresh ginger garlic paste and other spices, particularly in less quantity. No more chunky pieces and no more cleaning blender jar. Oh..those grooves, they are there for grip. They hold spices in place to be ground.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Not useful except for throwing
customer_reviews.text: I like how heavy it is, seems very durable. I bought it to make guacamole - it's terrible at this. The sides of the bowl are too shallow/wide, and when you try to mash, everything goes up the side and out the bowl. Plus it's hard to clean guac out of the purous stone. Might be better for crushing black pepper, haven't tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this , Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!! Heavy and made to last. Cleanup is easy. You can use it to grind and make anything. I grind up my herbs and spices for cooking and for making my body scrubs. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: If you cook, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this one, too! It makes grinding so much easier! It is stable, secure, and durable. Top that off with quiet and efficient. Could anyone want more?
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: which is nice, because you don't have to put as much ...
customer_reviews.text: The mortar is heavy enough that it doesn't slide around and big enough that the things you are grinding aren't flying out of it. The pestle is also heavy, which is nice, because you don't have to put as much effort into pushing as you would for a lighter pestle. I also like the shape of it, it is as the picture shows, which is rounded. You can use both ends to grind. Also, it fits in my hand nicely. Yes, I am happy with this product, and yes, I would recommend this to a friend or family.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to break it in before you use it. Check YouTube for how to videos.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Well made. Just the right size. Pestle shape is a little awkward and heavy. Cone shaped would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: John Roaten

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: my wife loves this!! a bit heavy but has a nice feel and works great!
customer_reviews.author: windowshopper

customer_reviews.title: You'll Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Though much larger than I expected, I just love this beautiful, functional piece. Though it takes up space, it's so nice-looking that I want to leave it on my black counter and have it double as a fruit bowl.
customer_reviews.author: HearYe-HearYe

customer_reviews.title: Great Molcajete!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting one of these for a long time. I finally got one and love it!! I am so happy I chose this one. The size is great for making anything. It has the weight so it's not sliding around and is solid. I highly recommend this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Roach

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product works great.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, when wet you could see a repair was done but when it’s dry you can’t tell. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: After a good wash to get off the loose granite partials this ...
customer_reviews.text: After a good wash to get off the loose granite partials this was a great purchase. I do believe it's solid granite and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L.

customer_reviews.title: Good one..
customer_reviews.text: This is a good piece for the money and it is well made and delivered in a good package..
customer_reviews.author: James J

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Only down side is that I wouldn’t use it for food. It creates dust from the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinding device that gives awesome taste to food
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this kind of product for long. It's a great product. For the first use, grind whole coriander seeds and throw them away. After that, this Molcfajete will be perfect to grind anything.
customer_reviews.author: Reya

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product. No complaints except it turned out to be on the small side. You are pretty much limited to two Avocados plus the rest of the ingredients if you're making Guacamole. It is an excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Will surely reccomend you to buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this product I cook a lot of curry and sweets so this makes it easy to mash the garlic,ginger,all types of spices like cinnamon cloves and nuts like pista cashew almond and best of all its such a good size
customer_reviews.author: sheshan

customer_reviews.title: Great for fresh guac
customer_reviews.text: Love to keep fresh Guac. It does not hold a lot but it’s a nice touch and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was ment to do...I use my own dried herbs. This will pulverized even stems on most of them...don't won't use thick main branch.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't serve it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Due to the smooth texture of the rock used, and lack of porous surface, this molcajete will not be able to mash/ blend pepper skins. This is not like a traditional authentic molcajete but rather just a serving bowl that looks like one.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: The poor package for that kind of item
customer_reviews.text: Is an excellent item, but packaged was so poor and affected this mortar is cracked in the upper area and under too. I feel so sad, I m waiting with entusiasm to receive it. I want a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Torres

customer_reviews.title: I would rerun it if I can
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few times. After wash, the bottom of the bowl became darker color and I am afraid to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chao W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great once you smooth out by grinding with damp salt. Comes in handy around my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: EMROTV

customer_reviews.title: everything I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: thank you. the product is everything I thought it would be
customer_reviews.author: Rasha

customer_reviews.title: Nice material!
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot the material, it just a little small for what we expected, excellent for salsas and guacamole!!
customer_reviews.author: RAMSES INIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: and the pestle is a great design as well
customer_reviews.text: My first molcajete was open grain granite and a pain to clean. This is closed grain, very smooth, and the pestle is a great design as well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: W. Odom

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is GORGEOUS! Very sturdy and perfect. We used it at our Halloween party last week to stage our store bought guac... I think they bought it ;) Perfect for dips... Or I mean you could actually use it to make stuff, I guess. lol. Very impressed. Is heavy! But is supposed to be!
customer_reviews.author: Becca P.

customer_reviews.title: Very classy
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift. Very nice looking. Should come with instructions for preparing it though.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: lol it's a little more than I bargained for but best value.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge and heavy.. lol it's a little more than I bargained for but best value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just made my first batch of guacamole and it was the BEST I have ever eaten. This Molcajete made ALL the difference. We put little tabs on the bottom so it will proudly sit on our granite counter and I loved using it also set directly on the table for serving! Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for one for a long time. It is exactly what I wanted. Large bowl. Very heavy duty. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dagley

customer_reviews.title: Shallow basin
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make incense, and it works fine for that. It's not smooth, and has machine marks all over it though. It's very shallow. Maybe 2 1/2 - 3 inches deep.
customer_reviews.author: Birch Witch

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product fast delivery omg our Guacamole tastes so good. I will never buy guacamole from the store again. It's like the stone does make the flavor so rich!
customer_reviews.author: $choebwifey

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a wedding present for my friends.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Loved the birches
customer_reviews.text: Loved the purchase! However I recommend washing it very very thoroughly before the first use as there can be little granules of some kind in the guacamole if not!it's not as big as some of the reviewer's have suggested and is just enough to fit maybe 2 or 3 avocados.
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: Great size, although very very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Great size, although very very heavy. surface is rough which helps to macerate anything to a very small size. Good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: B Plumley

customer_reviews.title: A great mortar and pestle
customer_reviews.text: A great mortar and pestle! Perfect for making large quantities. Not too heavy. Obviously wash it before using, it came a bit dusty. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Thivierge

customer_reviews.title: Great piece
customer_reviews.text: It’s really durable. It’s actually a stone. So it’s nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Mas

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Mexican stone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after our trip to Cancun and taking a cooking class there during our stay. We have used it a couple of times and it seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: dcwuellner

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this product! It's risky buying online because you cant see the product in person, but this is great. I seen the same one as Walmart that was $17 but was a little smaller. This is a good deal, would absolutely recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Esperanza Trejo

customer_reviews.title: X mas gift and person loved the size and weight
customer_reviews.text: X mas gift and person loved the size and weight, does not move and the pours inside the bowl allow you to tear herbs and leaves down extremely quick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rock
customer_reviews.text: As advertised! Nice chunk of granite. Easy to polish and clean up. Seems to be a good size for us.easily pulps vegetables for dishes.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Spice Grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Worth EVERY penny! What a difference versus using a fork or a spoon in a bowl. This makes the most amazing guacamole and it is beyond easy. I think this is my new favorite cooking tool in the universe!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Teter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very authentic; just like the one my Grandmother always used!! ❤
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: authentic molcajete
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly like what you find in a Mexican restaurant. I love serving guacamole in this dish!
customer_reviews.author: Connie T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting for along time to have one of these and I finally got it and I'm in love! It's great to finally have one that's inexpensive and does the job
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Winchester

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small
customer_reviews.text: It's a little too small. If you want to make salsa for 2 people buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Franky&Lilliez

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very high quality and made of very heavy material. It was much larger than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Luna

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Aunt who loves to make guacamole. It’s very sturdy and heavy! She loves it! This is the biggest one I’ve seen so far!
customer_reviews.author: Terese312

customer_reviews.title: Unusually awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought Id use something like this, but turns out it works out fabulous when adding garlic, mustard seeds, any spices want to blend in flavor instead of cook or stand. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this, following online directions on cleaning and seasoning. Can't wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy! Much larger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Super heavy! Much larger than I expected. Way bigger than a cereal bowl. Very nice quality. This will need those little self-adhesive felt protectors on the bottom to save the counters and storage space from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Lpilot

customer_reviews.title: Nothing wrong with it - but it's giant! lol ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with it - but it's giant! lol I wasn't expecting it to be so big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Fields

customer_reviews.title: I went through the process of seasoning it so that i wouldn't get any granite pieces in my food and so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: exactly as expected. Heavy, durable, large but not to large, rough not smooth. I went through the process of seasoning it so that i wouldn't get any granite pieces in my food and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: but I love I didn't have to season it before using it
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to a slightly different types from Hispanic stores, but I love I didn't have to season it before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn F Ansel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and sturdy, but the surface was rough
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and sturdy, but the surface was rough, and had to be sanded, as pieces were breaking off with use.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Cyphers

product_meta.title: IMUSA USA Granite Molcajete Spice Grinder 6-Inch, Gray
product_meta.description: Size:6”Crush it! Made from ultra-durable natural granite, this mortar & pestle extracts essential oils from herbs and spices - dried & fresh. Granite's nonporous qualities prevent it from absorbing those oils, keeping the flavor in your food and not in the tool. The weight of the stone provides stability and makes pounding a cinch. This molcajete is large enough to grind up a party-size batch of guacamole, then mix and serve it in the same bowl. So break out the tortilla chips and let's have a Fiesta.
feature_bullets: Beautiful Serving Piece, goes Seamlessly From Kitchen to Table
Ideal to Prepare Salsas, Dips, Guacamole, Spices and More; Ideal 6 Inch Diameter, Making it Easy to Crush
